org.unbunt.ella
Class DefaultContext

java.lang.Object
  org.unbunt.ella.DefaultContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
Context, SQLResultProvider
public class DefaultContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements Context

Default implementation of the Context interface.

On creation, it initializes the available native objects and a global environment where the objects are exposed in.

The following table gives an overview of the native objects and their names in the environment.

Name Native Object
Null NullImpl
null NullImpl
Sys SysImpl
Obj Base
Lst Lst.LstProto
Dict Dict.DictProto
Str Str
Num NNum.NNumProto
BigNum NBigNum.NBigNumProto
Real NReal.NRealProto
BigReal NBigReal.NBigRealProto
Range NRange.NRangeProto
Bool BoolImpl.BoolProto
true BoolImpl
false BoolImpl
Clos ClosImpl.ClosProto
Func FuncImpl.FuncProto
JArray JArray.JArrayProto
JClass JClass.JClassProto
ConnMgr ConnMgrImpl
Conn Conn.ConnProto
Stmt Stmt.StmtProto

See Also:
Context

Constructor Detail

DefaultContext

public DefaultContext()
Creates a DefaultContext with an empty set of program arguments exposed in the environment.

The program arguments are made available to the programs executed within this context under the ARGV name as an object of type Lst.

See Also:
Lst

DefaultContext

public DefaultContext(java.lang.Object[] args)
Creates a DefaultContext with the given program arguments exposed in the environment.

The program arguments are made available to the programs executed within this context under the ARGV name as an object of type Lst.

Parameters:
args - the objects to be used as program arguments
See Also:
Lst

addSQLResultListener

public void addSQLResultListener(SQLResultListener listener)
Description copied from interface: SQLResultProvider
Registers an SQL result listener to be notified about incoming SQL results. If this listener is already registered, the request is ignored.

Specified by:
addSQLResultListener in interface SQLResultProvider
Parameters:
listener - the listener to be registered.

removeSQLResultListener

public void removeSQLResultListener(SQLResultListener listener)
Description copied from interface: SQLResultProvider
Unregisters an SQL result listener so that it will no longer be notified about incoming SQL results. If there is no such listener is registered, the request is ignored.

Specified by:
removeSQLResultListener in interface SQLResultProvider
Parameters:
listener - the listener to be unregistered.
